alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 9:01AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Harnett, northeastern Cumberland and southwestern Wake Counties through 930 AM EST... At 900 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Lillington to near Godwin. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cary, Lillington, Fuquay-Varina, Dunn, Angier, Godwin, Holly Springs, Erwin, Coats and Wade. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EST for central North Carolina.
